page.title: 14TYPICAL FARM-HAREWOOD AREA
page.content: The average size is 200 acres,of mixed farming.Dairy cattle,pigs and sheep are kept,the latter fattened for sale.Maize,wheat and barley are grown for animal fodder.The land is GradeIII farming land,the soil being a medium loam.The buying and selling of animals and other products is at Otley,Pannal and Wetherby markets.The farmers work from 6a.m.to 7p.m.with little manual help.Machinery used includes tractors, drills,forage and combine harvesters. Fertilisers are essential today, mainly pesticides and fungicides.Over the last decade farming has become big business and is one of Britain's most essential industries. Most farmers were not in favour of the proposed motorway through the area though some felt it was better to use the poorer land here,than the GradeI land on an alternative route.
